intro: Cladocolea harlingii, commonly known as the Harling's cliffbrake, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its upright, wiry stems and small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences, producing tiny, greenish-white blooms. Cladocolea harlingii is adapted to arid conditions and is often found growing on limestone or sandstone outcrops.
